text:
You leave the grove behind. Its silence lingers like a thorn in the mind. The path steepens, carved into cliffside and time, and above you, two arching roots form an archway — the Second Crossroads.

Etched in the stone are glyphs long eroded, but one still burns faintly: a spiral devouring its own flame. You remember it. Not from this life, perhaps, but another. There’s no going back now. Each path forward is laced with finality.
lore: The Second Crossroads was once the meeting place of the Pale Watchers. They argued here beneath the dying trees until none remained to listen. Only the flame endured — buried, not broken.
